dataset.title: Delta Junction fire-chronosequence soil database: carbon, nitrogen, bulk density, and other properties

address.deliveryPoint: U.S. Geological Survey 345 Middlefield Road, MS 962

abstract.para: This dataset contains the results of a soil sampling efforts in the Delta Junction region. Soils were sampled at several sites of various stand ages (time since last fire) and soil drainage. The soils were sampled in 2000, 2001, and 2006. Data includes, but is not limited to percent carbon, percent nitrogen, 13C, 14C, bulk density, and soil texture/Von Post decomposition status.

section.title: Access to Data
section.para: While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

section.title: Use of data
section.para: Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

section.title: Citing Bonanza Creek LTER Datasets
section.para: It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

section.title: Experimental Design
section.para: These sites were measured to help us gain an understanding of how carbon and nitrogen stocks change over time as well as provide baseline carbon and nitrogen soil data.

dataTable.entityDescription: This dataset contains the results of a soil sampling efforts in the Delta Junction region; includes, but is not limited to percent carbon, percent nitrogen, 13C, 14C, bulk density, and soil texture/Von Post decomposition status.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Sample identification: The first four letter/numbers are the site identifier. Usually, (but not always) the first two letters represent the region of study, Donnelly Flats (DF) and the second two letters represent the study site. The number that follows these four characters indicates the plot/profile number. A decimal point separates the profile number from the basal depth of the sample (in cm).

textDomain.definition: Sample identification: The first four letter/numbers are the site identifier. Usually, (but not always) the first two letters represent the region of study, Donnelly Flats (DF) and the second two letters represent the study site. The number that follows these four characters indicates the plot/profile number. A decimal point separates the profile number from the basal depth of the sample (in cm).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Basal depth of that soil sample

Horizon type of the sample, as defined in the field. L = live moss, D = dead moss, F = fibric organic matter (OM), M = mesic OM, H = humic OM, A = A mineral soil horizon, B = B mineral soil horizon, C = C mineral soil horizon, E = E mineral soil horizon, LN = lichen, LT = litter. A lower case 'f' before horizon code indicates it was frozen at the time of sampling. A lower case 'b' before a horizon code indicates the sample showed evidence of burning (e.g. scorched, charred). A lower case 'g' indicates gravel was found in this horizon.

textDomain.definition: Horizon type of the sample, as defined in the field. L = live moss, D = dead moss, F = fibric organic matter (OM), M = mesic OM, H = humic OM, A = A mineral soil horizon, B = B mineral soil horizon, C = C mineral soil horizon, E = E mineral soil horizon, LN = lichen, LT = litter. A lower case 'f' before horizon code indicates it was frozen at the time of sampling. A lower case 'b' before a horizon code indicates the sample showed evidence of burning (e.g. scorched, charred). A lower case 'g' indicates gravel was found in this horizon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A brief description of the sample.

textDomain.definition: A brief description of the sample.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The date the sample was obtained
Dry weight percent of soil particles not passing through a 2 mm sieve after gentle crushing.
Dry weight percent of roots larger than 1 cm in diameter in the sample.
Grams of oven-dried soil per cubic centimeter, with soil particles greater than 2 mm and roots greater that 1 cm diameter removed.
Grams of oven-dried soil per cubic centimeter for the entire soil sample with no fractions excluded.
The percent water in the sample, by volume, assuming similar moisture and bulk density samples.
Percent, by weight, of moisture remaining in a sample after air-drying to constant weight as determined by subsequently oven-drying.
Percent by weight of soil particles greater than 0.05 mm in the sample remaining after removal of particles greater than 2 mm and roots greater than 1 cm diameter.
Percent by weight of soil particles in the size range from 0.02 to 0.05 mm in the sample remaining after removal of particles greater than 2 mm and roots greater than 1 cm diameter.
Percent by weight of soil particles in the size range from 0.002 to 0.020 mm in the sample remaining after removal of particles greater than 2 mm and roots greater than 1 cm diameter.
Percent by weight of soil particles less than 0.002 mm in the sample remaining after removal of particles greater than 2 mm and roots greater than 1 cm diameter.
Notes regarding the sample.
Root abundance and size using conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S., 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

textDomain.definition: Root abundance and size using conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S., 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

attribute.attributeDefinition: The pH of the sample, either determined in the field or in the lab using a LaMotte pH kit.

textDomain.definition: The pH of the sample, either determined in the field or in the lab using a LaMotte pH kit.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Color of moist soil based on the Munsell soil color chart.

textDomain.definition: Color of moist soil based on the Munsell soil color chart.

attribute.attributeDefinition: If organic soil, the classification using the von Post scale of humification (Damman, A.W.H, and T.W. French 1987. The ecology of peat bogs of the glaciated Northeastern United States: A community profile. Biological Report 85(7.16), U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Washington, D.C.). If mineral soil, the soil texture class as described in the field following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S., 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.). Note that some samples were submitted for particle size and may have more accurate texture descriptions based on these data.

textDomain.definition: If organic soil, the classification using the von Post scale of humification (Damman, A.W.H, and T.W. French 1987. The ecology of peat bogs of the glaciated Northeastern United States: A community profile. Biological Report 85(7.16), U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Washington, D.C.). If mineral soil, the soil texture class as described in the field following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S., 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.). Note that some samples were submitted for particle size and may have more accurate texture descriptions based on these data.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Plasticity following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S. 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

textDomain.definition: Plasticity following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S. 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Stickiness following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S. 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

textDomain.definition: Stickiness following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S. 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Moist consistence following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S. 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

textDomain.definition: Moist consistence following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S. 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Grade, size, strength and type of soil structure following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S. 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

textDomain.definition: Grade, size, strength and type of soil structure following conventions of USDA-ARS (Staff, S.S. 1998. Keys to Soil Taxonomy, 8th edition. Pocahontas Press, Inc., Blacksburg, Virginia. 599 pp.).

attribute.attributeDefinition: Height of each basal depth above the mineral soil boundary. Therefore, the bottom organic layer is at zero and all mineral horizons are negative numbers.
Percent by weight of carbon in an oven-dried soil sample with material >2 mm or 1 cm diameter removed.
Percent by weight of nitrogen in an oven-dried soil sample with material >2 mm or 1 cm diameter removed.
The deviation of the 14C/12C ratio from Modern (where Modern is by definition 1950).
Error associated with ?14C value.
